definition: "speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
yes (used by Emperor or ruler)/OK/to accede/to assent
imperial edict/see also 聖諭|圣谕[sheng4 yu4]
variant of 曉喻|晓喻[xiao3 yu4]
imperial edict/see also 上諭|上谕[shang4 yu4]
to issue a directive/to instruct (that sth be done)
(literary) to inform (the public)/to give clear instructions/public announcement (from higher authorities)
Fukuzawa Yukichi (1835-1901), prominent Japanese Westernizer, liberal educator and founder of Keio University
variant of 諷喻|讽喻[feng3 yu4]

sentences.english: First, that they were entrusted with the oracles of God.
sentences.chinese: 第一，是神的谕言信托了他们。

sentences.english: Either Patricia or Fiona because they are ladies.
sentences.chinese: 莫小玲或谢宛谕，因为她们是女人。

sentences.english: Government warning. Stay clear from birds and never feed them.
sentences.chinese: 奉政府谕，切勿接触或喂饲禽鸟。

sentences.english: Big Dan advances that don't shower your cat by toilet brush, thank you for your cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 奉大丹谕请勿使用厕所刷帮猫只洗澡，多谢合作。

sentences.english: In verse the oracles divine were heard.
sentences.chinese: 神的旨谕在诗句中频显现。

sentences.english: Both to the people and sent into the oracle to address, male aggregates worship table malaysians.
sentences.chinese: 既至，遣人入交址谕以利害，公蕴拜表谢罪。

sentences.english: Xie all along as she is cute.
sentences.chinese: 我一直都很喜欢谢宛谕，她很可爱。

definition: imperial edict/see also 上諭|上谕[shang4 yu4]
(history) to have an audience with the Emperor
